author: plcplc
title: Universal news subscription
description: News organisations rely heavily on ads that rewards clicks which result in poor quality content.

assessments.note: It a really interesting suggestion for an application. The problems that I see is, that the main problem is not a technical. There are quality news that rely at least less on ads but they need to get the fund from other sources like subscriptions. Getting people to pay for subscriptions it hard and even if the applcation would find people that are willing to do it, I doubt that the "producer" of the article would have enough incentive to provide different news as they already have for their existing newspaper.
I think that the proposal has merit and is a good idea, however the weakness might be that it seems still to be a concept in development, not fully thought out.

In today's world, where there's lots of talk about 'fake news', there is need for applications that encourage higher quality journalism.
At the same time it will provide confidence in Cardano and establish it as a trusted entity.

This is a novel use of the Cardano blockchain which, if successful, would bring attention to the ecosystem.  Demand for independent news (eg Substack) has been increasing as frustration grows with paywalls, so this idea seems have some demand.
This proposal sounds very similar to other projects such as DLive, which has some community following.

I like the concept. It has definitely a great use case that could be deployed with help of cardano ecosystem. Would have liked to learn more why Cardano is really the right choice from authors as well. The presentation most revolves around how it would be deployed but not too much on conceptual level of how it all aligns with mission/goals of Cardano. That link would have been better made in the beginning.
If successful the proposal would bring in news consumers to the cardano blockchain. it is not clear how this would the content creators would be compensated in this model.
I don't doubt the technical qualifications of the proposer, but there are many non-technical factors in this proposal.

The plan is not sufficiently developed in detail, while the requested funds of USD 50000 is a lump sum without a breakdown of expenses. The proposer has experience, but lacks a team and does not provide a plan for staffing the team - apart from general observations

The proposer seems to have the right skillset to develop this. It relies on solid mechanics that provide ROI.
What is lacking, though, is how user adoption will be promoted. How will it be marketed?

The detailed plan and experience demonstrate commitment to the idea. However, the proposer is yet to start working on the project - there is no code repository, wireframes or sequence diagrams to consider how the application operates

Great concept BUT major deficiency in terms of additional information provided. There are no external links provided that we could look at previous work done, some references or just professional profile of sorts like Linked in. Learning more about people would end up building this solution is a key element that I'm presently missing. Going even further - I am missing break down of budget against deliverables. There is only one grand figure but we don't really get to understand how this proposal would benefit from that amount, etc. A bit of planning around that would have helped showcase proposal in better light.

the proposer has experience in software development however it isn't clear how the business negotiations would be determined. the dapp will rely on converting new sites to stop advertisements in favor of accepting crypto payment.
The article addresses the challenge of the technical implementation and engaging with news sites. The chances of success are very uncertain. The approach seems very reasonable.
The proposal does not provide sufficient information to assess how feasible it is - due to a lack of detail.
A roadmap and funding breakdown would make this easier to assess.
The proposal has been sufficiently ideated, is well structured and in my estimation the demand for the application is there.

There is some slight attempt to outline what deliverables are required - we can loosely consider these are milestones but there isn't really a roadmap that we can place these on. There is no sense of timeline at all. Nor do authors think about what success metrics we will consider as community once funding is provided. There are no KPIs suggested. Further, author also doesn't look into some challenges/risks that we could consider when implementing their solution. All of the above would have added more colour to proposal and make it more investable. At the moment - it is just a concept/an idea.
The proposer has great ideas, but it is unclear how many new cardano users it will bring to the blockchain. No clear budget, scope or timeline is presented.

solution: Introduce a DApp with associated token. Users purchase token and gets ad-free access to participating news sites. DApp pay sites accordingly
experience: I have 7 years of professional experience as a software developer. 4 of those are with Haskell. Also MSc. in Computer Science.
